content: 1 all the ends designed by carol trouba for those little leftover balls of cotton yarn this dishcloth is a great way to use up cotton scraps with no ends to weave in yarn 54 yards 32 grams lily sugar n cream worsted weight cotton needle size us 7 4 5 mm **tip 1 allow 120 for casting on and the first two row allow 65 for 2 row a little more than 1 gram for the body of the dishcloth allow 72-75 for the last row and bind off **tip 2 you may want to plan out your progression of colors before starting once you ve tied the knot after each 2 row it s harder to go back i like to knit a 10-stitch swatch without cutting the yarn to see how the colors look picture below copyright © 2025 carol trouba all rights reserved all the ends email fancystepsknits@gmail com 2 **tip 3 tie a knot at the end of every two row as follows with the wrong side of the dishcloth facing you make a loop with the two ends and bring the ends though the loop see pictures below slide the knot as close to the dishcloth as you can pull the two ends apart from each other to tighten the knot close to the dishcloth guiding the knot to where you want it to be instructions you ll need 120 yarn for casting on
